meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be erased.
meanings.sent1: The erasability of the whiteboard allows us to correct mistakes easily.
meanings.sent2: Pencil marks have good erasability, making them ideal for sketching.
meanings.sent3: I wish my memory had the erasability of a whiteboard, so I could forget embarrassing moments.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had an erasability that could wipe away any grudge.
meanings.sent5: The erasability of the sand on the beach reminded him of the fleeting nature of time.

meanings.definition: The ability to be removed or wiped away.
meanings.sent1: The erasability of the ink on the paper surprised me.
meanings.sent2: Chalk has great erasability on the blackboard.
meanings.sent3: The magician's erasability of the drawing on the paper amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: His anger had an erasability that vanished as quickly as it appeared.
meanings.sent5: The erasability of the clouds in the sky made them look like giant erasers.
